CatDescriptText: Mrs. Emmett C. Brown, widow, 2660 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 2, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe Negroes, who get public assistance, do more cheating than whites?" answer reads: "I would say that it is about the same. However, whites have more opportunities to cheat.  The reason is because they can get jobs much easier and therefore can be working while still receiving public assistance."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Emmett C. Brown wearing light colored hat with flower and netting, light colored branch with leaves patterned dress, fur, standing between Yellow Cab and man in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
